item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Novalis
item.description: "Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason." -- Novalis

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "All of old. Nothing else ever. Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers." -- Voltaire

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then â€” to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Antonio Machado
item.description: "I dreamt -- marvellous error! -- that I had a beehive here inside my heart. And the golden bees were making white combs and sweet honey from my old failures." -- Antonio Machado

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "I do not judge the universe." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "I am learning to see. I don't know why it is, but everything enters me more deeply and doesn't stop where it once used to. I have an interior that I never knew of... What's the use of telling someone that I am changing? If I'm changing, I am no longer who I was; and if I am something else, it's obvious that I have no acquaintances. And I can't possibly write to strangers." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Whosoever is delighted in solitude, is either a wild beast or a god." -- Aristotle

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself." -- Rumi

item.title: Cecilia add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "We shouldn't be looking for heroes, we should be looking for good ideas." -- Noam Chomsky
